author: YL
title: Cyril Féraud papa : l'animateur partage une adorable photo avec son fils Tim
text: L'animateur vedette de France Télévisions Cyril Féraud a partagé un cliché émouvant avec son fils Tim pour leur premier Noël ensemble. Une belle photo de dos qui a fait fondre les internautes. Cyril Féraud, figure incontournable du PAF, a vécu un Noël très spécial cette année. En effet, le présentateur de "Slam" et "Le Quiz des Champions" a fêté pour la première fois les fêtes de fin d'année avec son fils Tim, né il y a environ 6 mois. Pour marquer le coup, il a publié sur son compte Instagram une photo attendrissante le montrant de dos avec son bébé, face à un majestueux sapin de Noël entouré de cadeaux. Un Noël magique en famille "Le plus beau Noël. Lumineux, Doux et Joyeux Noël à tous", a sobrement écrit Cyril Féraud en légende de ce cliché intime partagé avec ses plus de 150 000 abonnés. L'animateur de 48 ans, d'ordinaire assez discret sur sa vie privée, n'a pas résisté à l'envie d'immortaliser ce moment unique. Il faut dire que l'arrivée d'un enfant change la donne, même pour ce bourreau de travail habitué des plateaux télé. "C'est le premier Noël avec mon petit garçon, donc ce sera particulier. Décorer pour la première fois la maison, le sapin, et lui montrer tout l'univers des fêtes, c'est assez magique, même s'il est encore tout petit", a confié le jeune papa à Télé Magazine. Une nouvelle vie de père et un emploi du temps chargé Depuis la naissance de son fils l'été dernier, Cyril Féraud doit jongler entre sa vie de père et son métier prenant d'animateur. Avec pas moins de 4 émissions à son actif actuellement, dont les quotidiennes "100% logique" et "Duels en famille", il croule sous les tournages. Toutefois, hors de question pour lui de lever le pied. "Sur ces 8 prochains mois, je connais à l'avance ce que je vais tourner", assure-t-il, déterminé à mener de front vie professionnelle et personnelle. D'autant qu'il avait attendu longtemps avant de pouvoir fonder une famille. La discrétion, maître-mot du nouveau papa S'il partage volontiers son bonheur de jeune père, Cyril Féraud met un point d'honneur à protéger son fils des médias. En 6 mois, il n'a posté que 3 photos de lui, toujours de dos ou sans dévoiler son visage. Un choix que les internautes comprennent et respectent. Reste à savoir si le bambin suivra les traces de son célèbre papa en grandissant. Une chose est sûre, il pourra toujours compter sur le soutien inconditionnel de Cyril dans ses choix de vie. Le plus important pour l'animateur étant de profiter de chaque instant avec son fils, loin des projecteurs.
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->arts and entertainment

author: Karen Musalo
title: Why Biden's new border plan is a terrible idea - Los Angeles Times
text:
Following months of rumors , on Tuesday the Biden administration unveiled an executive order designed to shut down the border to people seeking asylum, as well as a rule to implement it. The rule took effect at 12:01 a.m. ET on Wednesday, marking the administration’s most drastic ploy to restrict asylum yet.
With limited exceptions, the rule closes the border to people seeking asylum when crossings exceed a daily average of 2,500 for seven consecutive days, and only reopens when there has been a sustained decrease in arrivals. For more than three years, crossings have exceeded that threshold every single week, meaning restrictions will loom over the foreseeable future.
During these shutdowns, people fleeing persecution are ineligible for asylum and have only a slim chance at accessing two limited forms of protection — withholding of removal and Convention Against Torture relief — if they can meet a far higher standard than that required for asylum. But to even have the chance to obtain these forms of relief, asylum seekers will be required to proactively express their fear at arrival and prove the strength of their claims — most likely without the assistance of an attorney or the opportunity to gather evidence.
Advertisement
Politics
Tired and confused, first migrants reach California border after Biden’s asylum order How President Biden’s executive order limiting asylum is playing out on the California-Mexico border.
June 5, 2024
Withholding and Convention Against Torture protections only prevent the person from being returned to their home country. Unlike asylum, they do not lead to likely lawful permanent resident status and then citizenship, and they do not allow an individual to bring their spouse or children who may have been left behind in the home country — consigning families to separation. Anyone who seeks protection and is denied may be subject to a five-year bar to reentry and face a potential criminal prosecution upon attempted return.
Putting aside the punitive nature of the new rule, if it has the desired effect of temporarily reducing crossings, it is not hard to imagine the chaos a swinging door of asylum will cause at the border. An asylum shutdown will force people to congregate in northern Mexico, where many will fall prey to violence. Thousands of individuals who attempt to enter when the border is officially closed will be subject to processing and removal by immigration authorities, and it’s not at all clear that the agency has the means to return them all to their home countries, or whether the U.S. will negotiate with Mexico to accept those being expelled.
Biden’s executive order met swift condemnation from rights groups , the UN Refugee Agency and progressive lawmakers who agreed: It is not just a harsh rightward shift on immigration. It contravenes both U.S. law and international norms, which prohibit the return of refugees to countries where they face persecution or torture.
Opinion
Opinion: How to turn down the pressure on the southern border Should migrants ‘get in line and wait their turn’? What if there is no line? What if we changed that?
Feb. 6, 2024
The move is the latest in a series of restrictive policies ripped from the pages of Donald Trump and Stephen Miller’s immigration playbook . The administration’s new rule relies on the same legal authority underpinning the Muslim Ban, and is reminiscent of Trump’s asylum ban that was challenged and struck down by the courts. Civil rights groups, including the ACLU , have pledged to challenge this policy too.
President Biden has touted his executive order as necessary to “restore order” and “gain control” of the border, despite crossings plummeting in recent months. His Department of Homeland Security claims that such restrictions will “deter irregular migration” at a time of political backlash against a narrative of chaos at the border.
But time and time again, we have seen how crackdowns on asylum only exacerbate chaos and dysfunction at the border, while doing nothing to “deter” people who are fleeing for their lives, or to address the root causes of forced migration. People seeking asylum at the U.S. border come from countries with widespread human rights violations and high levels of violence , which combined with climate change and economic under-development are strong push factors for migration. When people see no path to survival at home, draconian restrictions will only force them to pursue more perilous crossings.
Advertisement
Opinion
Opinion: How anti-immigrant bigotry hugely misunderstands our economy To recognize immigrants’ tax contributions and spending power, California has pioneered programs that should be imitated and expanded.
April 9, 2024
On Tuesday Biden stated that his new rule will merely close the door to those who “choose” not to avail themselves of other “legal pathways.” He seems to forget that our refugee laws, unanimously passed by Congress more than 40 years ago, expressly state that anyone arriving at our border — even if they are not at a port of entry — has the right to seek asylum. So asylum seekers are availing themselves of legal pathways.
Biden came into office with a promise to restore “the soul of our nation” and our country’s “historic role” as a leader in refugee protection. Unfortunately, he has abandoned this principled commitment based on the false belief that his political survival largely depends on being tough on immigration.
Smart policies and the allocation of adequate resources would allow the U.S. to accept and fairly process asylum seekers in a timely fashion. This would not only be good policy, but good politics. Most voters — and the overwhelming majority of the president’s base — support a fair and legal asylum system and reject exclusionary, Trump-style policies.
A particular irony in the timing here is that Biden announced the executive order within days of the 85th anniversary of the iconic voyage of the St. Louis, a ship that sailed from Germany with Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi Germany. They were turned away by both Cuba and the United States; the ship returned to Europe, where about a third of the passengers perished. The St. Louis is often invoked as a seminal event that led to the creation of our current global refugee protection system. There couldn’t be a better time to raise its memory as an example of what can happen when refugees are turned away.
Karen Musalo is a law professor and the founding director of the Center for Gender and Refugee Studies at UC Law San Francisco.

author: Grace Wride
title: Colorado Springs weather: A sunny, warm final Saturday of 2023, colder New Year's Eve ahead
text:
Colorado Springs is forecast for a sunny and bright Saturday, according to Meteorologist Alan Rose with Gazette news partner KOAA.
"A ridge of high pressure will deliver an exceptionally nice day of weather to Southern Colorado on this final Saturday of 2023," Rose said.
The high is expected to be in the low 50s with temperature dropping to around 23 in the evening, according to the National Weather Service in Pueblo.
Clouds will increase in the evening, making for mostly cloudy skies. This is expected to continue into Sunday, according to Rose.
Looking ahead
"The first in a series of disturbances will roll into the state on Sunday," Rose said. "This storm won't do much precipitation wise, with only a few light snow showers in the mountains. In the Pikes Peak Region, Sunday will be cooler and cloudier, with our daytime high only warming into the lower 40s."
Monday is expected to warm up to the upper 40s and have more sunshine, Rose said.
Tuesday will likely bring colder weather and a light dusting of snow in the mountains and possibly Teller County.
"Looking at the big picture, no significant storms appear to be on the horizon over the next five to seven days," Rose said.

author: Guillermo Domínguez
title: El ritual más poderoso de La Güera de las Estrellas para iniciar 2024 con éxito y dinero | El Heraldo de México
text: "Yo sé que han pasado por años difíciles, especialmente todos hemos pasado por pruebas y vengo a decirles que viene un año bien diferente, bien positivo", son las palabras con las que la [Güera de las Estrellas](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/tendencias/2023/12/25/la-gera-de-las-estrellas-revela-los-colores-ideales-de-los-signos-zodiacales-para-despedir-el-2023-565081.html) vaticina que todo apunta a que la humanidad tendrá un 2024 que se alejará de todas las malas vibras que se acumularon durante este ciclo. No obstante, la astróloga advirtió que todos aquellos que se han encargado de atentar en contra de los otros o han buscado aprovecharse de una mano amiga tendrán las consecuencias de sus actos. Para quienes no han hecho nada más que el bien, destaca, viene una etapa de oportunidad. A todos aquellos que quieran mejorar aún más sus perspectivas ante la nueva vuelta al Sol, la experta da a conocer su mejor [ ritual para atraer el dinero](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/estilo-de-vida/2023/12/27/uvas-lentejas-asi-las-debes-colocar-en-tu-hogar-para-que-no-te-falte-el-dinero-en-2024-565466.html) y el éxito durante 2024. Sigue leyendo: [3 objetos que debes sacar de tu clóset para renovar tu energía y atraer la abundancia en 2024](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/estilo-de-vida/2023/12/29/objetos-que-debes-sacar-de-tu-closet-para-renovar-tu-energia-atraer-la-abundancia-en-2024-560664.html) [¿Cuándo es la fecha ideal para quitar el árbol de Navidad en México?](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/estilo-de-vida/2023/12/28/cuando-es-la-fecha-ideal-para-quitar-el-arbol-de-navidad-en-mexico-565545.html) ¿Qué necesitas para hacer este poderoso ritual de Año Nuevo? Antes de iniciar cualquier tipo de acto ceremonial, comenta la Güera de las Estrellas es indispensable respirar, hacer una reflexión sobre lo que se quiere hacer, así como lo que ha logrado y mantener una energía positiva. Para realizar esta actividad son necesarios los siguientes elementos: - Un cirio azul rey. - Un cirio dorado. El cirio azul rey es un elemento que se debe usar debido a que es año de San Miguel Arcángel, mientras que el dorado tiene la intención de atraer la riqueza. ¿Cómo se lleva a cabo este conjuro para recibir el 2024 con dinero? La Güera de las Estrellas recomienda que las personas lleven a cabo esta práctica en sus hogares el [31 de diciembre](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/tendencias/2023/12/28/por-que-cerramos-los-ojos-al-pedir-un-deseo-565614.html). Inclusive comentó que se pueden regalar cirios de los colores antes mencionados a los amigos, familiares y seres queridos que llegan a la cena de Año Nuevo antes de empezar con este conjuro. Para ejecutarlo es necesario que todos tengan una fuente de fuego a la que puedan acceder de manera rápida y de forma eficaz, debido a que se requiere mucha precisión. Una vez que inicien las 12 campanadas que despedirán al 2023, el que participe en este proceso deberá encender la mecha de su vela para que comience a activarse las propiedades de esta. En cada uno de los 12 últimos segundos del ciclo, se debe mencionar todos los meses con su mes correspondiente, pero en retroceso. Es decir, se debe seguir la siguiente configuración: - 12: enero. - 11: febrero. - 10: marzo. - 9: abril. - 8: mayo. - 7: junio. - 6: julio. - 5: agosto. - 4: septiembre. - 3: octubre. - 2: noviembre. - 1: diciembre. Una vez que se haya mencionado a diciembre, indicó la experta a la que se puede seguir a través de su cuenta de Instagram @lapsiquicademexico, se debe gritar: 2024 feliz año nuevo. De esa forma, los que hayan realizado este acto iniciarán con dinero y prosperidad el próximo 2024. La vela se puede sostener en la mano, pero no cambia el resultado en caso de que se use un candelabro u artículo similar.

author: Kayla Clarke
title: Winter weather causing crashes across Southeast Michigan: Track traffic here
text: Most of Southeast Michigan is under a [winter weather advisory](https://www.clickondetroit.com/weather/alerts/) on Friday. Accumulating snow started moving into the region Friday morning, which can mean a difficult time for some drivers. Michigan State Police are reminding drivers to slow down, leave early, and wear seatbelts. Here is how much snowfall each area will when and when, according to [Meteorologist Ashlee Baracy](https://www.clickondetroit.com/weather/2024/03/22/accumulating-snow-in-metro-detroit-how-much-will-fall-on-friday/): - The Thumb to M-59: Snow will peak at two times, from 6 a.m.-10 a.m., and from 4 p.m.-10 p.m. Upward of 4 inches of accumulation is possible. - M-59 to I-94: Expect 1-3 inches of accumulation with two peak times, 6 a.m.-10 a.m., and again in the evening. - I-94 corridor and south: Snow will peak at two times, from 6 a.m.-10 a.m., and from 8 p.m.-midnight. 1-2 inches of snow are possible near I-94. Expect less than an inch of accumulation for those more south, closer to the state line. MDOT of Metro Detroit is tracking road and lane closures due to crashes. Check the links below for the latest information: MDOT’s Twitter/X profile is embeded below, but the latest posts will only be visible if you’re logged in.
